paper_abstract: This paper considers the regularized learning algorithm associated with the least-square loss and reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces. The target is the error analysis for the regression problem in learning theory. A novel regularization approach is presented, which yields satisfactory learning rates. The rates depend on the approximation property and on the capacity of the reproducing kernel Hilbert space measured by covering numbers. When the kernel is C-infinity and the regression function lies in the corresponding reproducing kernel Hilbert space, the rate is m(-zeta) with zeta arbitrarily close to 1, regardless of the variance of the bounded probability distribution.
paper_title: Learning rates of least-square regularized regression
